name: Coley Shaker
description: Inspired by David Wondrich and Greg Boehm's private collections. Named for Ada “Coley” Coleman, a British bartender from the turn of the last century when British bars favored a version of the American two-cup shaker with both cups made of metal. Ice-pulverizing, deep-frosting heavyweight 2-piece shaker. Made to an exacting standard for easy separation after shaking. Traditional Silver-Plated EPNS Finish. Hand-wash Only

name: Koriko Weighted Tins
description: A Set of 2 Koriko® Weighted Tins large and small has a 2 drink capacity. Koriko® Tins are designed for a good fit with easier separation after shaking. Small Weighted Shaking Tin 18oz (532ml) & Large Weighted Shaking Tin 830ml. Gold-Plated shakers are NOT dishwasher safe.

name: Leopold Weighted Tins
description: Leopold® Tins are designed for a good fit with easier separation after shaking. This Set of Leopold®Weighted Tins (large and small) has a 2 drink capacity.. Dishwasher safe.

name: Volney Shaker
description: Inspired by David Wondrich and Greg Boehm’s private collection. The Volney is based on an American design of the 1870’s that became so entrenched in the City of Lights that it has forever since been known as the “Parisian” Style 715ml (24oz) Parisian style shaker. Traditional Silver-Plated E.P.N.S. Finish. Hand wash only

name: Usagi Cobbler Shaker
description: Made to an exacting standard for easy separation after shaking. 18/8 stainless steel. 1 drink capacity. 500ml (17oz)

name: Ginza Jigger
description: Accurate and consistent for getting precise measurements. 18/8 stainless steel with brushed finish.1oz (30ml) over 2oz (60ml), with ½oz (15ml), ¾oz (22ml), and 1 ½oz (45ml) markings on the inside

name: Leopold Jigger
description: Accurate and consistent. 18/8 stainless steel. 1oz (30ml) over 2oz (60ml), with ¼oz (7.5ml), ½oz (15ml), ¾oz (22ml), and 1 ½oz (45ml) markings on the inside

name: The Gigger
description: Based on a historical design. Mathematically calculated for an absolute 4:1 ratio. .75oz (22ml) / 3oz (89ml) measurements for a total volume of 3.75oz (111ml). Handwash only. Does not include inner markings of measurements

name: Leopold Jigger Copper
description: Accurate and consistent. Copper plating over stainless steel. All plated items are not dishwasher safe. 30ml over 60ml, with 10ml, 15ml, 20ml and 40ml markings on the inside

name: Teardrop Barspoon
description: Smooth coil. Stainless steel. 30cm length

name: Teardrop Barspoon Matte Black
description: Smooth coil. Matte Black. Not dishwasher safe. 30cm length

name: Hoffmann Barspoon
description: Reproduction of a classic turn of the century bar tool used at the famed Hoffman House of New York City. Smooth coil. Stainless steel. 33.5cm length

name: Skull Barspoon
description: Developed in collaboration with Jeff 'Beachbum' Berry. Smooth coil with a skull top. Stainless steel. 33cm length

name: Skull Barspoon Gold Plated
description: Developed in collaboration with Jeff 'Beachbum' Berry. Smooth coil with a skull top. Gold plating. 33cm length. All plated items are not dishwasher safe

name: Trident barspoon
description: Inspired by the traditional Japanese design. Decorative trident top. Smooth coil.Stainless steel.31.5cm length

name: Bulu Pineapple Barspoon
description: Developed in collaboration with Daniele Dalla Pola. Smooth coil with a pineapple top. Gold-Plated.Not dishwasher safe. 33.5cm length

name: Yarai Mixing Glass
description: This heavy duty mixing glass is the workhorse of the industry. For use with 30cm spoon and the Julep or Koriko® Hawthorne Strainer. Dishwasher safe. 1-2 drink capacity. 5.25in (13.3cm) height x 3.5in (9cm) diameter

name: Seamless Paddle Mixing Glass
description: For use with 30cm spoon and the Julep or Koriko® Hawthorne Strainer. Seamless interior for quieter stirring. Dishwasher safe. 1-2 drink capacity. 5.25in (13.3cm) height x 3.5in (9cm) diameter

name: Mixtin Stirring Tin
description: Designed in collaboration with Nico de Soto. Features an etched pandan leaf design. 18/8 stainless steel with a brushed finish. Double-walled and vacuum insulated for temperature consistency. 6in (152mm) height x 4in (101mm) diameter. Dishwasher safe

name: Koriko Hawthorne Strainer
description: Developed by Don Lee. Made for heavy use with a very tight coil. Designed to make it easy to do a true split pour. Fits large and standard mixing glasses. 18/8 stainless steel

name: Antique Style Hawthorne Strainer
description: Based on a hawthorne strainer that was patented in 1892. Corrugations at the base of the handle that hook on to the mixing glass or shaker rim to keep the strainer from slipping. Fits large and standard mixing glasses. Stainless steel

name: Premium Julep Strainer
description: Based on a 1930s strainer we consider to be the best ever created. Fits large and standard mixing glasses. Stainless steel with a mirror finish

name: Koriko 2 Pronged Hawthorne Strainer
description: Made for heavy use with a very tight coil. Designed to make it easy to do a true split pour. Fits most large and standard mixing glasses. Gunmetal Black over 18/8 stainless steel. Not dishwasher safe

name: Lagavulin 16 year old
description: A much sought-after single malt Scotch whisky with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.

name: Laphroaig 16 Year Old
description: A limited edition expression released by the legendary Laphroaig Distillery in mid-2021, matured for 16 years in American oak casks. Plenty of familiar south coast Islay smokiness, mellowed slightly by the sweetness imparted from the casks, culminating in a rewarding dram perfect for evening sipping.

name: Nikka Whisky From The Barrel (50cl, 51.4%)
description: The award-winning Nikka Whisky From The Barrel blend is absolutely full of flavour. Bottled at 51.4% ABV. The blend combines both single malt and grain whisky from the Miyagikyo and Yoichi distilleries, which are then married in a huge variety of casks, including bourbon barrels, sherry butts and refill hogsheads. A huge depth of flavour in this stunning Japanese whisky. We can't recommend this enough.

name: Woodford Reserve Kentucky Bourbon (70cl, 43.2%)
description: The mashbill for Woodford Reserve features a high percentage of rye: 72% corn, 18% rye and 10% malt. The whiskey is also unusual for being triple distilled and having the lowest proof upon entering the barrel where it matures for at least six years. A must have Kentucky bourbon. Makes a wonderful Old-Fashioned cocktail!

name: Knob Creek 9 Year Old (70cl, 50%)
description: Knob Creek is a small batch bourbon produced by Jim Beam, distilled in a more traditional style and aged 9 nine years. It is named for the area in Kentucky where Abraham Lincoln grew up, it is said that the creek nearly claimed his life when he was swimming.

name: Willett's Pot Still Reserve (70cl) (70cl, 47%)
description: A 70cl bottling of the excellent Willet's Pot Still Reserve - not only is it a cracking small batch Kentucky bourbon, but it comes in bottles shaped like a pot still, which we love.

name: Maker's Mark 46 (70cl, 47%)
description: The first line extension to the Maker's Mark range since the '50s, Maker's 46 is essentially the standard expression with added spice. This bourbon was not intended to compete with the core expression, instead it's a cousin to it, something different for those that like spicy whiskey. They add this extra dimension by inserting seared French oak staves into the barrels. It's utterly stunning.

name: Mount Gay Eclipse Heritage Blend 70cl / 40%
description: The 2020 release of Mount Gay Eclipse is a fruity, floral rum with aromas of banana, apricot, vanilla and honeysuckle on the nose. The palate offers notes of toasted oak, juicy fruit and soft smoke that linger into the finish.

name: Goslings Black Seal Rum 70cl / 40%
description: A brilliant dark rum for mixing, produced in Bermuda since 1806. The name comes from the black wax originally used to seal the bottles. Rich and well balanced this has enticing notes of butterscotch, vanilla and caramel. The signature serve is with ginger beer in a Dark 'n' Stormy.

name: Spirited Union Spice & Sea Salt Botanical Rum
description: Chefs enhance flavours with salt, so too can mixologists. But this rum doesn’t use just any salt - it uses organic anana salt sourced from an ancient seabed which complements the natural sweetness of its cask aged Barbados rum. Five botanicals are also added with the end result being a rum with a fuller flavour.

name: Smith & Cross Rum 70cl / 57%
description: A mix of heavy bodied Wedderburn style rum and medium bodied Plummer, Smith and Cross is an excellent Jamaican rum that's making waves in the bar world. Bottled at 57%, navy strength, and intensely flavoured, this works well in cocktails but also has a depth that rewards those who like to sip their rum.

name: Diplomatico Reserva Exclusiva Rum Single Modernist Rum 70cl / 40%
description: A fabulous Venezuelan dark golden rum, distilled from molasses in a copper pot still before it's aged for up to 12 years. Rich, sweet and fruity, just how we like 'em. Diplomatico Reserva Exclusiva is one of the most awarded rums, with more than 20 awards to its name.

name: Appleton 12 Year Old Rum Bot.1980s 75cl / 43%
description: A 1980s bottling of Appleton's 12 year old dark golden rum.

name: El Dorado Rum 21 Year Old 70cl / 43%
description: This glorious, full-bodied rum of exquisite taste and character was launched in late 2002 and has quickly established itself as one of the finest on the market.

name: Plymouth Gin 70cl / 41.2%
description: An elegant redesign of Plymouth, matching up their much respected and geographically protected gin with an old-school chunky bottle and their traditional branding. A must have for any home cocktail bar or lovers of a gin and tonic.

name: Ableforth's Bathtub Gin Cask Aged 50cl / 43.3%
description: Winner of Best Cask Gin at the World Gin Awards 2016, this tempting tipple from Ableforth’s is a masterclass in spice. It takes all the distillery’s typical vibrancy of orange zest and candied peel, vanilla and a whip-crack of coriander and enriches it with a thick and smooth buttery undertow. A touch of ripe red fruit and a whiff of fudge lift the end to a light, aromatic climax.

name: Gordon's London Dry Gin Bot.1950s 75cl / 40%
description: A 1950s bottle of Gordon's still popular dry gin, closed with the popular spring cap.

name: Monkey 47 Schwarzwald Dry Gin 50cl / 47%
description: A curious gin from the Black Forest in Germany. Made with 47 (yes, really) botanicals and bottled at 47%.

name: Mare Mediterranean Gin 70cl / 42.7%
description: A Mediterranean-inspired gin that uses four principal botanicals: basil, thyme, rosemary and Arbequina olives, as well as the traditional juniper berries.

name: Hendrick's Gin 70cl / 41.4%
description: A superb, and utterly unique, pink-tinged gin from William Grant's. Infused with rose petals and cucumber as well as the normal botanicals, this is a must for all gin-lovers. In the summertime, Hendrick's makes a fantastically refreshing gin and tonic: serve in a tall glass with plenty of ice and garnish with thinly-sliced cucumber – delicious!

name: Sipsmith London Dry Gin 70cl / 41.6%
description: Sipsmith’s London Dry Gin is distilled from the finest English wheat spirit with ten carefully selected botanicals, and blended with the exceptionally pure water of Lydwell spring, the source of the River Thames. The result is an interpretation of the classic London Dry style that nods to its heritage and emerges as a particularly dry gin with a wonderful burst of juniper and a zesty, citrus freshness.

name: Rutte Celery Gin 70cl / 43%
description: Rutte's Celery Gin is a combination of traditional old-world methods with a contemporary new-world twist. Celery has been used in Rutte's gins since it began producing, and this is a light and citrusy gin with a hint of celery. This will make a great Red Snapper – just use this instead of vodka in a classic Bloody Mary recipe.

name: Courvoisier XO Cognac 70cl / 40%
description: Rich and full-bodied, yet still exceptionally smooth, this luxurious XO contains long-aged eaux-de-vie from Grande & Petite Champagne for grace & flavour, plus a little Borderies for structure and depth. A perennial award-winner.

name: Remy Martin XO Cognac 70cl / 40%
description: Aged for longer than the XO Special, this Fine Champagne contains 85% Grande Champagne eaux-de-vie. Remarkably smooth, rich and mellow.

name: Remy Martin Louis XIII Black Pearl 140th Anniversary 70cl / 40%
description: A special edition of Rémy Martin Louis XIII to commemorate the brand's 140th anniversary drawn from a single 100 year-old tierçon (blending cask) that contained eaux-de-vie ranging from 40 to 100 years of age. Just 775 of these stunning Baccarat Black Pearl crystal decanters were produced.

name: Don Fulano Blanco Tequila 70cl / 40%
description: Don Fulano Blanco is a delicate Tequila with complex aromas. Made from 10-year-old blue agave grown in rich red soil in Jalisco. This is rested for 60 days in stainless steel before being bottled.

name: Fortaleza Blanco Tequila 70cl / 40%
description: Fortaleza Blanco is made by the fifth generation of the Sauza family. Made using traditional methods, this is exceptional with notes of black pepper, earth and butter.

name: Fortaleza Reposado Tequila 70cl / 40%
description: From the highly regarded Fortaleza range of Tequilas comes this reposado. Aged for eight months in American oak, this has notes of vanilla, apple and cinnamon – delightful.

name: Del Maguey Vida Mezcal 70cl / 42%
description: A quality single village mezcal with its own endearingly peculiar labelling. An entry-level offering from Del Maguey, Vida is highly mixable and the most widely available of the range. Made with 100% organic agave.

name: Del Maguey Pechuga Mezcal 70cl / 49%
description: A legendary mezcal. 'Pechuga', as this mezcal is known, means chicken breast, referring to the chicken breast suspended inside the still in a basket of fruit during the third distillation.

name: Ilegal Joven Mezcal 70cl / 40%
description: An unaged mezcal from Ilegal, originally produced for the Café no Sé in Guatemala and thankfully now making its way out into the wider world.

name: Ilegal Anejo Mezcal 70cl / 40%
description: A longer aged version of Ilegal's mezcal - a rich buttery spirit with a lick of smoke that's reminiscent of aged rum and whisky.

name: Grey Goose Vodka 70cl / 40%
description: From Cognac in France, this breakthrough wheat-based small-batch ultra-premium vodka has achieved global success and won a Platinum medal at the World Spirits Championship. Clean and fresh, with a smooth, creamy texture.

name: Tito's Vodka 70cl / 40%
description: Tito's Vodka hails from Texas' first and oldest legal distillery in Austin. The brainchild of former geologist Tito Beveridge, this is six times distilled.

name: Ciroc Vodka 70cl / 40%
description: High-quality vodka from Ciroc, made from 'snap frost' grapes that are cold fermented before being distilled in a combination of steel and copper stills. The end result is a crisp and clean-tasting French vodka.

name: Don Julio Blanco Tequila 70cl / 38%
description: Don Julio Blanco is a high-quality white Tequila bottled immediately after distillation to maintain as much of the fresh agave flavour as possible.

name: Don Julio Reposado Tequila 70cl / 38%
description: A superbly smooth reposado, Don Julio is made with 100% agave and is aged just under a year in ex-bourbon barrels. A bit more special than your average repo tequila.
